subject: Add system attention indicators
commitMessage:
Add system attention indicators

- Different LEDs and statuses will be added to hardware status page
- Status for power will be shown and LED included is System identify Led

Signed-off-by: Sukanya Pandey <sukapan1@in.ibm.com>
Change-Id: I8689f7bf3cc02a7a90379ec50b005bf344c091e4

Patch Set 21: Code-Review-1

In testing, I found that:
1. The power indicator shows as on when the system is still in the progress of booting
2. The page had to be refreshed before the power off state changed to off

These could be related to the web sockets fix that is in review and we should test with that patchset to verify.

3. When the system is powering off, the text label say PoweringOff. Can this be changed to either Powering off or use the simmilar language from the Server power ops page and say Operation in progress or something similar?

4. The radio buttons are not working as expected. In the new section, when toggled, the toggle button text does not change to on. In the Systems table, the toggle button does not change states.

Patch Set 25:

There is an issue with  how the processors, but I want to keep this moving forward. I want to wait for the bug fix before we merge this though. Sukanya, can you just branch off of this commit and we won't have to worry about having to review everything again? If this is a small change, we should probably fix it in this patchset.

Patch Set 25:

> Patch Set 25:
> 
> There is an issue with  how the processors, but I want to keep this moving forward. I want to wait for the bug fix before we merge this though. Sukanya, can you just branch off of this commit and we won't have to worry about having to review everything again? If this is a small change, we should probably fix it in this patchset.

This functionality is not related to processor table, both are on hardware status page but are different entities.
Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as 05388966bc9ff2d65e7696c209a5827e82d61297 by Derick Montague
Maybe it will be better to keep the file name as 'HardwareStatusServiceIndicator'. Though it is making the name unusually big but it is matching the convention the project.

As per my understanding this toggle and system table identify LED are mapped to same locationIndicatorActive, shouldn't they both change if user toggles one of them? If yes, then you can make a change in the changeIdentifyLedState function. Take reference from https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/webui-vue/+/42077. Correct me if I m making a mistake while testing. 😊
Just curious, why this v-if with false?
We have no data related to system attention LED, to show false as per the invision screens, i have it kept hard coded as false.
we can use global.status.on or off

As per design they were having capital "ON" and "OFF", global.status.on is a small letter "on"
, let me ask designers before making a change.

you can remove "sys", it is already implied when it's all put together as 

pageHardwareStatus.systemIndicator.attentionLED
same, we keep acronyms camelCased here
Is the system attention LED property not available yet? Can you leave a TODO comment in the markup?
We can remove and push this downstream instead

do we need this? will there be a case where there is no system? 
I think we should still show this section and show "--" for each definition list if the property doesn't exist
is this key being used in this commit? We should probably add this later since it's not in the vue template yet
do we need this? can just use `systems` instead
Yes, I can remove that, this condition was required to avoid error while loading the component, I have handled it now under systems computed property itself.
We need to add span for indicating on and off state of the toggle.
Let's get the URL from the hypermedia link, please.
Can we remove this since this is not something that will be implemented upstream?

To move away from hardcoded paths something like the following would be better.


.get('/redfish/v1')
  .then((response) => {
    return axios.get(response.data.Systems['@odata.id']); // using response.data
  })
  .then(({ data }) => commit('setSystemInfo', data))
  ...
Nevermind. We determined during standups today that this is the best way to handle this for now.
This is still hardcoded, other systems could potentially name `system` something else, can we target the odata id for system?
Nevermind. We determined during standups today that this is the best way to handle this for now.
While outside of the scope of this commit, this could be done the same way.
